result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua G Vukoty Flowers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua G Vukoty Flowers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua G Vukoty Flowers was found guilty of Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. Peter Masana
Filed by Atty. Peter Masana

Defendant Joshua G Vukoty Flowers in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 1 year probation, conds: $443 costs. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Six month review to be done.   Submit DNA sample.  Ct. 2 dismissed.  Court granted 1 day jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
